column4: Anyone use a good program to backup a computer with say 60GB of information across multiple DVDs without having to split a tar file into 2.5GB files. Yes, I basically want an idiot-proof program I can start, point it at all the data I want to back up and then insert a new DVD when required.
My past attempts to use 'upgrade' to move up to the latest Ubuntu release met with disaster.
Save your data, make a list of programs you want on your 'new' computer and install 6.1 fresh. That's what I did.
Am I allowed to post a link to a forum page in here for the CD burning question?
Others do and I don't see anything wrong with it
Everything I have learned about Linux I have learned from IRC and forums. Need some good links?
sure, I'm always willing to collect info sources. I'm just saying a lot of these questions are easily answered by a resource manual.
I generally recommend these: http://ubuntuforums.org/  http://www.tldp.org/  http://g-scripts.sourceforge.net/  http://www.onlamp.com/linux/cmd/
This is a nice one too: http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/index
thanks. can i cut and paste from the forum?
It's good to use the pastebin for more than 4 lines.
well no i meant to copy the links you gave me. I copied everything to a file and will just delete what I don't want. Thanks again.
You should be able to right-click on a link in XChat and choose Open in browser from the context menu.
